description: This notification indicates that the loop attenuation
value) has been reached/exceeded for the HDSL2/SHDSL segment

event.Summary: SHDSL loop attenuation ($v1 db) exceeded threshold

description: The current loop attenuation for this endpoint as reported in
a Network or Customer Side Performance Status message.
Special value of -512 represent, that the value is out of range (line unlocked) or not applicable (line locked).
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn

description: This object configures the loop attenuation alarm threshold.
When the current value of hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn reaches
or exceeds this threshold, a hdsl2ShdslLoopAttenCrossing
The possible range is restricted to 0..127. 0 = off, 1 to 127 valid threshold
There is a range mismatch between RFC 4319 (range -127..128) and G991.2, which defines the range
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshLoopAttenuation

description: This notification indicates that the SNR margin threshold (as
per the hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshSNRMargin value) has been
reached/exceeded for the HDSL2/SHDSL segment endpoint.

event.Summary: SHDSL SNR margin ($v1 db) exceeded threshold

description: The current SNR margin for this endpoint as reported in a
Special value of -512 represent, that the value is out of range (line unlocked) or not applicable (line locked).
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrSnrMgn

description: This object configures the SNR margin alarm threshold.
When the current value of hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrSnrMgn
reaches or drops below this threshold, a
The possible range is restricted to 0..15. 0 = off, 1 to 15 valid threshold
There is a range mismatch between RFC 4319 (range -127..128) and G991.2, which defines the range
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshSNRMargin

exceeds this value, a hdsl2ShdslPerfESThresh MAY be
generated. At most one notification will be sent per
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshES

description: This notification indicates that an endpoint maintenance
loopback command failed for an HDSL2/SHDSL segment.
This object controls configuration of loopbacks for the
associated segment endpoint. The status of the loopback
is obtained via the hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrStatus object.
Loopmode 2 and 3 are standard defined. All other modes are proprietary
and not supported by all lines (only be supported for interfaces of iftype sdsl (96)).
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackConfig

description: This alarm indicates impending unit failure due to loss of local power
Not supported on SHDSL cards based on the Lantiq SOCRATES SHDSL
transceiver family. For such cards, see shehdsl2ShdslAtucPerfLpr.

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'Unit failure alarm cleared' : 'Unit failed due to loss of local power'

description: This alarm indicates that the link between the line card and CPE has been
disconnected (lost) for unidentified reasons, e.g., dying gasp not received.
Not supported on SHDSL cards based on the Lantiq SOCRATES SHDSL

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'Line card and modem connected' : 'Line card and modem disconnected due to unidentified reason'

variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileControlTimeStamp

description: Interfaces of type sdsl (96) support modes 1..5 and mode 3..5 are proprietary!
Interfaces of type shdsl (169) will support mode 1..2 and 6..7!
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileControlWireInterface

description: Technical usefull minium and maximum values depend on the configured WireInterface mode:
twoWire mode -> minimum should be 200 kBits -> maximum should be 5704 kBits
fourWire mode -> minimum should be 400 kBits -> maximum should be 11408 kBits
sixWire mode -> minimum should be 600 kBits -> maximum should be 17112 kBits
eigthWire mode -> minimum should be 800 kBits -> maximum should be 22816 kBits
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileControlMinLineRate

description: Technical usefull minium and maximum values depend on the configured WireInterface mode:
twoWire mode -> minimum should be 200 kBits -> maximum should be 5704 kBits
fourWire mode -> minimum should be 400 kBits -> maximum should be 11408 kBits
sixWire mode -> minimum should be 600 kBits -> maximum should be 17112 kBits
eigthWire mode -> minimum should be 800 kBits -> maximum should be 22816 kBits
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::shehdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileControlMaxLineRate

description: Interfaces of type sdsl (96) support only value localClk(1).
Interfaces of type shdsl (169) support also the mode networkClk(2).

event.Summary: VCC TP ATM mode set to $v2

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpControlTimeStamp

description: This parameter configure the used AtmMode for the table entry.
The default setting is 'aal5VccTp' and this value represent the already available functionality
for this VccTp entry as known from all NE releases up to R4.7M.
There are a certain number of restrictions for the new setting 'pwAtmVclTp' with R4.7M:
- Only supported for VccTp's on IUSHDSL:48E:ME:E and IUSHDSL:48E:8Q:E!
- Only supported if the underlaying SHDSL Span configuration use tcLayer 'atm'.
- Only supported if the feature 'atmPwe3' is enabled in sheSystemFeatureCapabilityTable!
- If the AtmMode was modified to 'pwAtmVclTp' the corresponding bridgePortTable-entry will be
modified also and change his bridgePortMode to 'useAtmoE'.
- If the AtmMode was modified to 'pwAtmVclTp' there will be a corresponding entry created
inside the shePwAtmAcTable with identical index value.
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAtmMode

event.Summary: VCC TP admin state changed to $v2

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAdminStateChanged SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAdminState i 1
$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAdminStateChanged SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAdminState i 2

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpControlTimeStamp

description: Enable/disable single VccTp. Default value is enabled.
-> can only be activated if VccTpAtmMode = 'atmPwe3'
variables.name: SHE-SHDSL-MIB::sheShdslVccTpAdminState
